alert.note: Alert for Cherokee (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 04 at 11:21AM EST until February 04 at 8:30PM EST by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Peachtree City GA has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Georgia... Etowah River at Canton affecting Cherokee County. For the Etowah River Basin...including Landrum, Dawsonville, Dawsonville, Dawsonville, Dawsonville, Free Home, Barrettsville, Ball Ground, Northeast Canton, East Canton Downstream I-575, Canton, Waleska, Woodstock, Big Shanty/Kennesaw, Blackwells, Woodstock, Kennesaw, Mars Hill, Below Allatoona Dam, Rockmart, Cartersville, Dallas, Kingston, Kingston, Rome GA 1 Loop, Rome Coosa Valley FG... Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Etowah River at Canton. * WHEN...Until this evening. * IMPACTS...At 16 feet, Flood Stage is reached. Minor flooding begins in the woodlands and fields along the river upstream and downstream from the gage by the Walaska Street bridge. Low lying portions of recreational areas such as Boling Park behind the Cherokee County High School...the Cherokee County Fairgrounds and the Etowah River Greenway at Heritage Park will begin to flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:15 AM EST Friday the stage was 15.7 feet and rising. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late this morning to a crest of 16.2 feet this afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage this afternoon. - Flood stage is 16 feet. &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at weather.gov/atlanta.
